simple.description: Size of correlation frame in samples
Input overlap in samples. Must be smaller then correlationSize. Negative numbers are allowed which means you skip input data

NORMAL is the standard autocorrelation layout where the center spike is in the middle of the output frame
ROTATED flips the front and back of the display. This puts the center spike at index 0 and frame index chorosponds exactly to the delay. This makes it easy to measure the correlation delay.
SUPERIMPOSED is like ROTATED but the 2nd half of the output frame is flipped and added to the first 1/2. autocorrelation will be approximatly symetric for indicies close to 0 since the correlation output for a dealay of N is approximatly the same as an advance of N for small N. The superposition adds the correlation output for the delay as well as the advace to get twice the averaging effect.
Zero out the center chorosponding to no delay. This will always be a "huge" value. So zero it out so it doesn't effect the display.
